description: From Latin digitātus for the adjective and digitāre for the verb.

entries.meaning: Having digits, fingers or things shaped like fingers; fingerlike
(botany, anatomy) Having parts that spread out from a common point in a finger-like manner.

verbs.description: digitate (third-person singular simple present digitates, present participle digitating, simple past and past participle digitated)

entries.meaning: To point out as with the finger.
(botany, anatomy) To spread out from a common point in a finger-like manner.
